intro: Reseda schimperi, commonly known as Ethiopian mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with five petals and numerous stamens, typical of the family. Reseda schimperi is often found in rocky or sandy soils at higher elevations.
